com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources

Class SourceBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources.data.DatumBase
      • com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources.SourceBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Datum, Source
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DateSource, RequestSource, RootSource, UserSource, VariableSource

    public abstract class SourceBase
extends DatumBase
implements Source
    The base class that all Source implementations extend. There is one important feature to note in the design of this class: the DatumDefs object that is the sole argument to the constructor. These DatumDefs objects are constructed statically when each subclass is first instantiated. Because constructing that object is relatively expensive, we do it exactly once per execution of the JVM, and then squirrel away the result in the DatumDefs object. This makes every subsequent construction of the subclass a very light-weight affair, both in terms of memory consumption and CPU consumption.
    Author:
    Tom Dilatush tom@dilatush.com
